attributes.action: Force the Football Association to Change Their Retrospective Action Law
attributes.additional_details:
Force the Football Association to Change Their Retrospective Action Law -

We have just seen a horror tackle by Mcmanaman on Haidara, but the FA say that they cannot take action because an official saw the incident!

They are wrong. They can take action, but choose not to because of their out of touch and out of date laws.

Every other league, like in France and Germany, decisions can be made after the final whistle in hindsight. However, the FA have refused to take any action, ONCE AGAIN.

I am only 17 years old but have seen the likes of Diaby, Eduardo and Ramsey, all of Arsenal, suffer almost career ending injuries, yet no more than 3 match bans have been given.

Last week Mcmanaman most probably ended Haidara's season, if not more, yet there was no card and no ban.

Things must change
